main event: An orange-colored light was observed flying over San Antonio, Texas at approximately 2300 hours on 21 July 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of an orange held at arm's length., The object was observed flying straight and level, disappearing at a 45-degree angle., No sound, tail, or exhaust was noted during the sighting., The observer initially thought it was a shooting star but realized it was too low and large., The observation lasted between 2 to 4 seconds.
witness description: Civilian, a landlady whose reliability is unknown
